name: whipsaw
content:
whipsaw verb
(MOVE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] to move, or to make something move, quickly between two directions : The rope whipsawed back and forth.fig Prices on the stock exchange whipsawed wildly.

whipsaw verb
(AFFECT BADLY)
[ I or T ] to defeat or affect someone badly, especially in two ways at the same time: Families are being whipsawed by high prices and low wages.

to influence shares, etc. in a way that makes their value change very quickly, so that it is difficult to know what will happen next: Fluctuations in world energy prices have whipsawed the fortunes of oil companies for decades.be/get whipsawed New York shares were whipsawed, with an early recovery giving way to a short-lived bloodbath at midday.
